alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Harrison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 4:14AM EDT until June 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Carroll, Coshocton, Guernsey, Harrison, Jefferson OH and Tuscarawas. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following counties, Brooke, Hancock and Ohio. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 AM EDT, Another round of thunderstorms will provide additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch where between 1 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wheeling, Weirton, Steubenville, New Philadelphia, Dover, Martins Ferry, Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Cadiz, Carrollton, Warwood, Wellsburg, Bethlehem, West Liberty, Triadelphia, Clearview, Valley Grove, Freeport and Wintersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
